====Usage notes====
Minor strokes in the shape of ハ/八, as in the top of [[劵]], can be referred to 八. These are very frequently simplified to [[丷]]. Contrast [[劵]]/[[券]], and different forms of {{lang|ja|[[鬲]]}}/{{lang|und|sc=Hans|鬲}}.

==Chinese==

===Glyph origin===
{{Han etyl}}
{{liushu|ic}}: 八 is two bent lines indicating the original meaning of "to divide". This character is later borrowed to mean "eight" because of homonymy, making the original meaning obsolete (now represented by {{zh-l|*別}}).

===Etymology 1===
{{zh-forms|alt=捌-financial}}
From {{inh|zh|sit-pro|*b-r-gjat ~ b-g-rjat|*b-r-gjat|eight}}. Compare {{cog|bo|བརྒྱད}}.

====Pronunciation====
{{zh-pron
|m=bā
|m_note=bá - a less common tone sandhi variant of 八 when it occurs before a departing-tone character, e.g. {{l|zh|八路}}
|ma=y
|m-s=ba2
|c=baat3
|h=pfs=pat
|md=báik
|mn=zz,kh,tn,tc,yl:peh/xm,qz,tp,lk,sx,km,mg,hc:poeh/pat
|mn_note=peh/poeh - vernacular; pat - literary
|mn-t=boih4
|w=4paq
|mc=y
|oc=y
|cat=num,n
}}

# {{lb|zh|printing}} [[pearl]]; The [[smallest]] [[size]] of [[usual]] [[type]], [[standardize]]d as 5 [[point]].
# {{zh-abbrev|八卦}}
## to [[gossip]] (about); to [[stick one's nose in]]
